# Introduction {#intro}

## What is statistical modeling and what do we need this for?

In rather broad sense a [statistical model](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Statistical_model) 
is a mathematical representation  of a real-world process or relationship between variables. 

In most cases, one simplifies the complex reality in order to make it better
understandable, mathematically treatable and to make predictions.

Underlying our models, there are theories which should be falsifiable and testable.
For instance, I would be really surprised if I pull up my ........

It is a simplification of reality that allows us to make predictions and draw conclusions from data.
